course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Understanding Western Architecture
course.description: This course gives students fundamental knowledge of the masterpieces of Western architecture and the variation in styles in different epochs and cultures, from ancient Greece to the 21st century.
course.prerequisites: a passing letter grade in LANG 1401 OR LANG 1402 OR LANG 1403 OR LANG 1404 OR LANG 1002 (prior to 2022-23)

reviews.author: kykyw
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1: Terminology and Chronology
Week 2: Greek Architecture
Week 3: Roman Architecture
Week 4: Early Christian Churches, Byzantine Architecture
Week 5: Carolingian, Romanesque Architecture
Week 6: Gothic
Week 7,8: Renaissance
Week 9: Baroque and Rococo
Week 10: Classical Revival Styles
Week 11: New Trends in 19th Century
Week 12: Modernism
Week 13: Contemporary Architecture
reviews.comment_grading:
Assessment:
1. 2 Short quizzes (50%) â€“ MC, True/False, fill-in-the blanks and short questions
2. Final exam (40%) â€“ MC, True/False, fill-in-the-blanks, short questions and essay writing
3. Attendance (10%) â€“ to be checked 10 times randomly, 1% will be deducted for each absence

reviews.author: cjchoi
reviews.title: Requires background in arts and history
reviews.comment_content:
The content includes basic details of the influential western architectural styles.
Week 1: Terminology and Chronology
Week 2: Greek Architecture
Week 3: Roman Architecture
Week 4: Early Christian Churches, Byzantine Architecture
Week 5: Carolingian, Romanesque Architecture
Week 6: Gothic
Week 7,8: Renaissance
Week 9: Baroque and Rococo
Week 10: Classical Revival Styles
Week 11: New Trends in 19th Century
Week 12: Modernism
Week 13: Contemporary Architecture

IMO there are too many architectural styles covered in this course, so it just feels like the prof. is trying to speed run the ppt. every lesson to ensure the overall course progress does not lag behind.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is rather boring, maybe because of her never-changing tone. Although boring, everything she said in class was extremely useful in your essays in midterm and final exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment x2 (20%)
Midterm x1  (1 Essay 20%)
Final x1 (2 Essays 50%)
Attendance (10%)

The grading is fine, with a broad A range but also a broad C range, so dk if good grade or not.

3*A+, 4*A, 8*A-, 6*B+, 6*B, 8*B-, 9*C+, 7*C, 5*C-, 2*D, 2*F
(Total 60 students)
A range: 25%
B range: 33.3%
C range: 35%
D: 3.33%
F: 3.33%
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy. If you want a good grade, you need to memorize all the important terminologies and read most of the additional readings, which is very time-consuming.

This course requires more than just reading the ppts. and additional readings, it also requires students to have a basic understanding of western history, as most architectural styles are related to geopolitics and religions.

reviews.author: saleeab
reviews.title: HUMA 2680Understanding Western Architecture
reviews.comment_content: Content-wise, for those who are interested in ancient monuments and buildings to modern buildings would like this course. Also, someone who is interested in western art might find it interesting as well as it deals with all those western aesthetics. If you are not interested in these things, don't take this course because it is going to be super boring for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is a nice professor eager to answer all questions. But she does not go beyond her lecture notes, so sometimes it can be a bit boring. Maybe it is because I took an online course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not sure about how she decides which letter grade for the student.
Because I bombed the final but did well on the midterm essays, Take home exercises were just acceptable, but still got an A-.
Maybe I was just lucky, or maybe this is indeed a course that gives out good grades.

1. Take-home exercises 40%
2. Midterm essays 20%
3. Final essays 30%
4. Attendance 10%
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light in my point of view. However, the professor wants you to do more than just copying from the lecture notes. When I got a good grade on the exercises, it was when I actually thought about the question and answered after doing my own research.

reviews.author: angelina_zhang
reviews.comment_content:
10% random attendance checking
20% midterm
30% final
40% take home assignments
reviews.comment_teaching: She mentions a lot of important information when she is speaking so itâ€™s important to pay attention every lecture or at least rewatching the lectures to take additional notes. Sometimes can be boring but overall interesting material
reviews.comment_grading: No grading scheme, hard to figure out what the professor expects in take home assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: Reading is optional, 5 take home assignments in total that require 0.5-4 hours each depending on individual speed. Additional readings are helpful for assignments and exams. Midterm and final very straight forward.

reviews.author: mnmanaa
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is fair, because it's just a memory exam, if u spend more time to study it, you can get a good grade from it.
Mean for 2 times midterms and above mean for the final, got B+
reviews.comment_workload:
only 2 midterm and final exam, no otjer workload at all.
all things that are tested in mid-term and final are in the PPT, so u can just simply study the notes, but there are so many materials that u have to memorize, so it's better for u to have more time for the studying.

reviews.author: SChong
reviews.comment_content: Covers all the major periods of western architecture from Greek architecture to contemporary architecture. Explanation of the the different styles and features through numerous iconic examples from all periods.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor uses PowerPoint slides as the main guide. She covers each point on the slides with some additional explanation. While she is somewhat enthusiastic about the topics, the one hour twenty minute long lecture usually gets dull and boring towards the end.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good if you spend some time memorizing the information. All information that would be tested are on the PPTs, so it's quite easy to study. Studying can be boring.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework. The only workload is studying for the quiz and final, which doesn't take that much time

reviews.author: Bonnie Lai
reviews.comment_content:
A lot of content
Need to memorize it all
A lot of architecture words very long and difficult to remember
Each quizzes cover 4 powerpoints each with over 30 slides
Test about architectural features of different buildings and history  of architecture
reviews.comment_teaching:
Instructor read the powerpoint
All the information tested are written on the powerpoints
No need to attend the lectures
Poor accent
Very boring
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz 1: 11/25
Quiz 2: 11.5/25
Final Exam: 13/30
Grade: C
2 people got F this semester
You are likely to get at least a C if you put some effort
reviews.comment_workload:
No extra work only 2 quizzes and final exam
50% quizzes
40% final exam (need to write an essay)
10% attendence

reviews.author: Takeshikanshiro
reviews.comment_content: The course covers from ancient Greek architecture to Contemporary architecture. For this course, it doesn't matter that whether you have studied history or not ( It might help a little bit if you do ). HUMA 2680 mainly focuses on memorizing features of the buildings and the background knowledge of different architecture styles and periods.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Kwong mainly follows the slides to present the ideas of the architecture and styles of construction,sometimes supported by examples and some extra materials.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is clear as scores and final grade of each and every students ( represented by student ID ) are shown in the same table.
There are 2 quizzes(25% each), 1 final exam(40%)and participation ( 10% which only requires students to attend lectures and guest talk). Quizzes involve only mc and fill in the blanks while final exam involves a 10% essay.
Here are some statistics for your information
Quiz 1  16.4/25  sd=5.1
Quiz 2  14.8/25  sd=5.4
Final exam  23/40  sd=7.2
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is light in my opinion. There are some extra readings , that do not really help much for quizzes and exams in my opinion, for each and every topic covered in the course. For quizzes and final exam, reading and memorising the power point slides is quite enough.

reviews.author: kevincty
reviews.comment_content: Feel like traveling around the world once after taking this course! From ancient Greek to modern architectures, in this course, you will be like reading a traveling magazines, view many popular architectures in different countries, e.g. the Eiffel tower, the pantheon, many serene churches etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: A very nice local professor, always welcome students to ask questions during the lectures or the exam check
reviews.comment_grading: It's great, if you are always interested in watching beautiful architectures, you  should take this course!
reviews.comment_workload: Remember many terminologies but it is worth for it and will be very useful for knowing the history of a country.

reviews.author: ĞšÑ€Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ½
reviews.comment_content:
Great amount of architectures, architects, structures, principles, etc required to be memorised.
Historical background are included as related to the nature of architectures.
Think twice if you are not really interested in the content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Going rather fast in class, but points are gone through well.
Attending lectures are helpful in the quizzes and exam.
Anna is a knowledgeable lecturer in art history.

*1 voluntary visit is arranged.
